text: Per Jacobsson (5 February 1894 – 5 May 1963) was a Swedish economist. He was managing director of the International Monetary Fund from 21 November 1956 until his death in 1963.. thumb|International monetary problems, 1964 Jacobsson's daughter Moyra, an artist, married Roger Bannister, the British Olympic athlete and medical doctor who was the first person to run the four- minute mile. ==References== ==Other websites== *Biography – Per Jacobsson Foundation Category:1894 births Category:1963 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Managing Directors of the International Monetary Fund Category:Swedish businesspeople Category:Swedish economists
title: Per Jacobsson
